Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal. Mr. Bourgeault left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Mr. Bourgeault was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2014005323.CaseDesc: Darrell Hoshowski was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta, in July 1983. Prior to his disappearance, Darrell had made a withdrawal from his bank account. There is reason to believe that he may have travelled, and Vancouver, British Columbia and California were mentioned as being possible destinations.

Case reference: 2008005999.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1978, Brian McLean and his co-worker, Russell Thomas, were commercial fishing at their camp on MacDowell Lake, near MacDowell Lake First Nation Territory. Mr. Thomas advised that they left in separate boats to lift nets. He went to the west side of the lake and pulled four nets, then to the east side of the lake and lifted two more nets. He then realized that Mr. McLean was not there. Mr. Thomas headed back towards the camp and found Mr. McLean’s boat washed up against the shore approximately three or four hundred metres from the camp. The motor was in forward gear with the throttle off, and the paddle was missing from the boat. MacDowell Lake is 90 "air miles" north of Red Lake, and is accessible only by air. The area was searched, and the lake was dragged, but Brian McLean has not been found.

Pants: Oilskin, Green, Coveralls with blue suspenders
Amputation: Right Foot, all toes except big toe left

Case reference: 2012020098.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1975, at approximately 3:00 a.m., Irene Scherban was seen for the last time in front of her residence in Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. Prior to her disappearance, Irene had attended a party.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, HBCH High school insignia ring
Mark: Chest, Round birthmark located near ribcage area
Nose, Thin red mark below the bridge of nose

Case reference: 2013000139.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Clayton Condos. He was last seen on March 20, 2006, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014043999.CaseDesc: The partial cranium belonging to an adult male was found in 2013 in a wooded area north of Terrace, British Columbia. It is likely he was of Asian or Indigenous descent and appears to have sustained a significant facial injury in his lifetime. It is believed he was deceased for several years prior to his cranium being recovered.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Nose, Possible healed fracture of nose - Maxilla

Case reference: 2012020140.CaseDesc: Melina Martin of Sainte-Sabine was last seen on January 23, 2005 at 1:30 pm in the Bourbonnais park in Farnham.

Case reference: 2012020071.CaseDesc: Richard Tssessaze's last known residence was in Brandon, Manitoba.  He had previously lived in both Thompson and lac Brochet.  Mr. Tssessaze was last seen in downtown Winnipeg in the area of the St. Regis Hotel, located on Smith Street, in late June of 2009.  Since that time, Mr. Tssessaze has not been seen or heard from, and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002718.CaseDesc: Wayne Robinson was last seen on October 8, 1985, running away from his school in God's Lake, Manitoba. It is unclear what prompted Wayne to leave school during the recess period. An extensive air, water and land search was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2019019954.CaseDesc: On April 14, 2019, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Yonis and Mawahib Ahmed were seen for the last time with their mother Liyana Abdow at the Sojourn House in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010000499.CaseDesc: David Kruger was running a business with another individual, and was experiencing financial difficulties. On April 26, 1979, Mr. Kruger was last seen by his business partner, who reported him missing on May 2, 1979. He has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Kruger's mother had died approximately 3 weeks prior, so it is possible he may have been depressed. He was last seen at his residence in Guelph, Ontario.

Case reference: 1987203340.CaseDesc: Joanne Pedersen went missing on February 19, 1983, near her home at Vedder Crossing (Chilliwack). She was last seen with an adult male at a telephone booth.

Case reference: 2006022999.CaseDesc: Spike Jorgenson was last seen crossing Chief Bay, Lake Nipigon in a canoe on September 28, 1973. It is believed that his canoe capsized, and he is presumed drowned.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, at the second joint

Case reference: 2006015899.CaseDesc: Pamela Holopainen was last seen in the city of Timmins, Ontario in the early morning hours of December 14, 2003, following a house party.

Case reference: 2014003615.CaseDesc: On September 26th, 1970, Mr. Claus and his friend were reported missing to police as they were overdue by boat. A pilot later spotted a swamped boat on Cormorant Lake, Manitoba and advised police. Despite patrols and dragging operations Mr. Claus was never located. His partner was later found and the cause of death determined to be drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2018062802.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2000, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Yao Lin was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003366.CaseDesc: The morning of July 8, 1981,  the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP were notified that an aluminum boat with an outboard motor was going in circles just out from the new houses in Sheshatshiu, NL.  Police were advised that the boat was unoccupied and travelling quite fast in circles. The investigation determined that the boat had been once occupied by John Morris Groves of North West River, NL and it appears that he had fallen overboard.  The body of Mr. Groves has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2014002649.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1978, Garry Allen and a friend were fishing on Turtle Lake near Glaslyn, SK. Witnesses state the weather changed and the water got very rough. On October 20th, they were reported missing. A swamped canoe and the body of the friend was located, however, searches failed to locate Mr. Allen.

Case reference: 2014004274.CaseDesc: Frédéric Cormier was last seen on January 11, 2001, in the Vieux-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. Frédéric would pick up his son once a week, but he has had no contact since this date.

Case reference: 2014036537.CaseDesc: On October 2nd, 2014, a vehicle was located abandoned at 53122 Range Road 194 in Yellowhead County, Alberta. Investigators concluded that Natasha Klok was an occupant of that vehicle and that she went into a nearby heavily forested area. Ms.Klok has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001222.CaseDesc: On June 5, 1977, an unidentified man was found on the shore of Sasamat Lake in British Columbia. He had a moustache, long sideburns, and wore several unique pieces of jewelry. He would be approximately 70 years old today.

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2014006177.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1987, at approximately 9:00 p.m. Phillip Orvis went out onto the lake in his boat from Matheson Island. He was planning to go to his fishing camp at Black Bear Island. At the time that he left the water on the lake was very rough. Phillip could not swim and he was known to never wear a life jacket. His boat was found the next day drifted up against the mainland approximately 1/2 mile south east of the dock where he is believed to have left from. The boat was filled with water. Searches were conducted by land, air and water and dragging operations were conducted on the lake however his body was never located. Phillip Orvis is presumed dead due to drowning and foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004179.CaseDesc: Leona Brule from Fort Providence, NT, was reported missing by her mother in 1989.  Her mother had not heard from Leona for over a year.  Leona was considered transient at the time of her disappearance, and drug and alcohol use/abuse was suspected.  Some evidence indicated that Leona may have been on the streets in Edmonton AB in the1990's.  There was also a possible link to Florida.  Leona's disappearance was deemed suspicious from the onset due to high risk transient lifestyle.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 7 teeth treated, 5 absent.

Case reference: 2020011797.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1986, John Edwards was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, On left bicep

Case reference: 2021019518.CaseDesc: On May 16, 2021, Bernard Grempel was reported missing from Surrey, British Columbia. On May 14, 2021, Bernard’s last known activity was when he used his Compass Card to tap onto a bus that travels back through New Westminster, North Delta and stops at the Scottsdale exchange at 120th Street and 72nd Ave in Surrey. He was last seen wearing a blue medical mask.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Picture of Rick from Rick and Morty
Right Arm, We cannot resolve problems with the same…
Abdomen, Left rib - Other things may change but we start...
Left Upper Arm, Star of David

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2006020399.CaseDesc: Lawrence Prettie was last seen on October 23, 1994. His boat capsized on Lac Seul and he is presumed drowned. His body has never been recovered.  His boat, camping and fishing gear were located strewn about on an island in Lac Seul.

Case reference: 2014003474.CaseDesc: Christine Pelletier was last seen on July 21, 1988, in the Vieux-Rosemont District of Montreal, Quebec. Christine lived with friends, was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Winged horse on the back of the shoulder. Possibly a Pegasus

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest
Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents

Case reference: 2012020021.CaseDesc: Madison Scott went missing in 2011. She was at a party in the early morning hours of May 28th at Hogsback Lake, and was to camp there overnight. In the morning her friends found her tent and her pickup truck, but Maddy was nowhere to be found. Her purse was found in the truck but her phone and keys were missing. When Maddy didn't return home her parents became worried and reported her missing.

Case reference: 2014005431.CaseDesc: Mahendiran Ratnasingam last spoke with his ex-wife on June 8th, 2006, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000123.CaseDesc: The remains of a middle-aged man was discovered in a bush area in Beacon Hill Park in Victoria, British Columbia on July 18, 1988. He had grey hair and long sideburns or a beard. It appears the man died within a month from when he was found.

Case reference: 2015037946.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2015, Raymond Flett was seen for the last time in Thompson, Manitoba. Raymond is known to frequent the Split Lake and Thompson.

Case reference: 2018008636.CaseDesc: On February 6, 2018, at approximately 11:30pm, Guerman Pouchkine was last seen in the area of Steels Avenue West and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002590.CaseDesc: On April 15, 2000, Merlin Labrie was seen for the last time as he left a gathering with friends in Levis, Quebec. Merlin was supposed to meet up with a friend, but he never did and has not been seen since.

Mark: Head, Multiple beauty marks on the face

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006028499.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1968, at approximately 4:30 p.m., Robert James Brown was last seen walking  from the Nazarene Camp to his home in the Village of Wilfred, Ontario. The Nazarene Camp was a Christian camp near Pefferlaw, where Robert's mother worked as a volunteer.  He never arrived home and was reported missing to the Georgina Township Police Service. There were reports that a person matching Robert's description was seen in the vicinity of Georgina Beach around the time that Robert was last seen. Numerous land and water searches failed to locate Robert.

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1988. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2021045206.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2021, Mark Dolan was last seen by his family when he was dropped off at a bus terminal in Brantford, Ontario. His last banking transaction was captured on video at 294 Louisa Street in Parry Sound, Ontario, on October 28, 2021.

Luggage: Other, Multi coloured hiking style backpack.

Case reference: 2014005974.CaseDesc: Éric Descoteaux's relatives have had no news of him since January, 2009. Mr. Descoteaux lived in the town of Harrington in the Laurentians.  He left there without warning, and stopped contacting his relatives.

Case reference: 2014001151.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1977, the body of a young unidentified man was found in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had taken his own life with a new “Savage 240 Series P” rifle that had been purchased in Gatineau, Quebec five days earlier.

Jacket: Corduroy, Tan, Padded with leather pads on shoulder
Shirt: White, With blue dots, Made in France

Case reference: 2014004895.CaseDesc: Desmond Peter's grandmother saw him for the last time on March 6, 2007, she reported him missing a few days later. Desmond was not happy with his home life and would often leave the house for days, but he would always return.  During the first year of his disappearance there were several unconfirmed sightings of Desmond, however none of them were considered reliable enough to confirm his whereabouts.  All tips and information brought to the investigators continues to be followed up on.

Case reference: 2005005199.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1988, an unidentified man was discovered in a creek near Cushman Road in St. Catharines, Ontario. A black plastic comb was found in his pocket, as well as a Salvation Army registration card with the name ‘Roscoe Echo (21JUNE1923, Place of Birth: New York City).

Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, silver band
Shirt: White, Button up with red stripes

Case reference: 2014001952.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, James Neckoway and a friend left Bird, Manitoba by canoe to go hunting and fishing. They intended to travel down the Limestone River, and then down the Nelson River. The canoe in which the men were travelling and the body of Mr. Neckoway's friend were recovered on September 23. Mr. Neckoway has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2015066565.CaseDesc: George Wood was last seen in Surrey BC, on June 20, 2015 by family. At the time George Wood was reported missing, he was unemployed and of no fixed address living on the streets in Burnaby BC. His absence and not keeping in touch with family is out of character.

Belt: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black belt with large silver buckle
Scar: Right Arm, Long scar on right arm

Case reference: 2014005502.CaseDesc: Pinaskin Ottawa was last seen shopping on October 11, 2010, around 11:00 AM at the Atikamekw Community Grocery Store in Manawan. Since then, several investigations have been conducted in the vicinity of Manawan without success. He has not been seen or heard from since

Case reference: 2014004377.CaseDesc: On October 3, 2003, a family member contacted Police and reported that ROSS had been missing since the evening of October 1st. She indicated ROSS and his cousin were drinking together that night and that on their way home his cousin lost sight of ROSS in the bushes. ROSS did not return home. Numerous sightings were reported to police in the days following ROSS' disappearance however no one spoke directly to ROSS. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed. Further unconfirmed sightings were reported across Canada as well and were investigated. ROSS has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2008000499.CaseDesc: Kimberley Ann Amero was last seen at her residence in Saint John, New Brunswick on September 3, 1985. There has been no contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2012020036.CaseDesc: Monique Mattar has not been seen since April 20, 2009. She was known to lead a high risk lifestyle. Police investigations in regards to the whereabouts of Monique Mattar are ongoing.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2006016899.CaseDesc: Lisa Maas was last seen leaving a party in the Woodford area.

Case reference: 2014001524.CaseDesc: Matthew Leblanc was last seen by his sister on the morning of September 22, 1999, after he had coffee with her. Matthew was last observed at the bus stop located at the intersection of Superior/Menzies Street in Victoria. Matthew failed to attend an afternoon appointment and has not been heard or seen from since.

Case reference: 2012020066.CaseDesc: On October 22, 1988, in the early evening Betsy Owens was playing volleyball at the local school in Pauingassi, Manitoba. At approximately 11:00 pm Betsy left the school with her boyfriend, returning to his residence. Betsy was last seen by her boyfriend the following morning when she left his home. Despite several searches, Miss. Owens has not been found. An extensive investigation was conducted at the time and again in 1996-1997. Betsy's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2019010720.CaseDesc: Patrick Comeau was last seen on November 13, 2017, in Montreal, Quebec. Patrick has been known to frequent the downtown Montreal area.

Case reference: 2013000052.CaseDesc: Denis Lapensée was last seen on May 28, 1998, in Montreal and was reported missing on June 2, 1998. Mr. Lapensée suffers from schizophrenia and was very depressed following a breakup with his spouse. He has previously mentioned that he intends to throw himself off the Jacques Cartier Bridge. M. Lapensée has bad dentition, is right-handed and smokes a pipe.

Hat: White, toque, blue and red polka dot

Case reference: 2019028156.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2019, Tyler McMichael was seen for the last time riding his bicycle at the intersection of Commissioners Road East and Wellington Road in London, Ontario. It is believed that Tyler was heading to the Chatham area.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020135.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1988, Melanie Temperton was reported missing. She left her residence located in Mascouche on September 21 around 9:00 pm to go to Montreal, where she met friends in different places. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004359.CaseDesc: On July 20, 2003, Stephane Gallant was last seen at the Shoreline Hotel in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Stephane speaks French and English with a French accent.  Stephane worked in the logging industry as a woodcutter. On July 23, 2003, his vehicle, a 1984 GMC S10 blue pickup with a black topper, was located at the Trowbridge Falls campsite on Copenhagen Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020156.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet, 1/4 mile west of Brockton Point Lighthouse, Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2021006190.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1996, André Pellerin was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district in Montreal, Quebec. He left his residence in the morning to go to a shopping mall. André suffers from mental health issues and must take his medication every day. When he left his home, he had no medication with him.

Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Three-quarter length

Case reference: 2015022096.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014002176.CaseDesc: On October 1st, 1997 in Fort McMurray, RCMP received a report that Michelle Renee McGillion had not been seen since the evening of September 30th, 1997. Ms. McGillion's roommate reported that she had found a suicide note in the residence.  Ms. McGillion is described as having a substance abuse problem which included alcohol and prescribed anti-depression medication.  Ms. McGillion had ties to Fort McMurray, Alberta, Yukon, and Ontario, where her family resides.

Case reference: 2014001105.CaseDesc: The skeletal remains of a man were found along with camping gear in a wooded area near Chute Lake, BC in November 1991. He had a chip in one front tooth. It is estimated that he may have died several years prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Suit coat, Herringbone pattern
Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Button-down Lumberman flannel
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace-up dress shoes, re-soled

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014003380.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 1961, Brenda Byman was last seen on a hike with some classmates in the area of Wilmer, British Columbia, when she allegedly walked off into the bush and did not return. Brenda has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Blue, Parka, With pink hood

Case reference: 2013000100.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1969, Murdo Baker left his camp to tend to his fish nets. By August 28, he had not returned and Police were notified. Mr. Baker's boat was recovered by police however his remains have never been recovered. It is presumed Mr. Baker drowned.

Scar: Right Leg, Several scars below knee.

Case reference: 2013000120.CaseDesc: Lisa Marie Young was last seen in the early morning hours of June 30, 2002.  She went to a local bar, and met some male acquaintances after the bar closed. She and her acquaintances accepted a ride from another man whom they had just met.  Lisa Marie was last seen with the man in the vehicle, heading to get some food.  Her friends and family have not heard from her since, which is completely out of character. Due to the nature of this investigation, Nanaimo RCMP Serious Crime Unit requests that anyone with information contact them directly.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Hoop necklace with medallion
Tattoo: Right Arm, Band of flowers with heart

Case reference: 2014006077.CaseDesc: Schuyler Bierkos was last seen by his roommate at his home in Calgary, Alberta on February 24, 2013. The reason for his disapearance is unknown.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Usually has a beard
Scar: Head, severe acne and scars on face

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2005004799.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1991, an unidentified man was found floating in Lake Ontario, near 'Captain John's Boat Restaurant' on Queens Quay, west of Yonge Street near the Harbour Castle Hotel. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 166 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His skin was brown, perhaps suggesting a Middle Eastern, East Indian or North African ethnic affiliation. He had a wide nose and long slim fingers. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Black, Curly, Wavy, Hair shorter than collar; he had fine stubble on his face
Teeth: His teeth were in good condition with no restorations.
Money: $10.07 was found in bills and coin in his right front pocket
Shoes: Canvas, White, Cana Sport, running shoes; size 9 with white soles, LOT #21753
Belt: Brown, a narrow, light brown belt with a metal end
Underwear: Blue, Mr. Brief, jockey style; white waistband
Pants: Denim, Black, Levi's, size 33-34 with a button fly
Scar: Forehead, fine scars across his forehead
Head, fine scars between his eyebrows
Chin, small scars under his chin

Case reference: 2014005157.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2008, Heinz Meyer was seen for the last time in Haines Junction located in the Yukon. His vehicle was later found on Marshall Creek Road in Haines Junction.

Jacket: Cloth, Dark Green, Light Green, Camouflage

Case reference: 2018059144.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2018, Johnathan Braithwaite was seen for the last time as he was leaving the CIBC bank located on 45 King Street, in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Johnathan was despondent.

Scar: Torso (Front), Scar from two gunshot wounds

Case reference: 2014001178.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was found floating in the Fraser River near Prince George, British Columbia, on July 10, 1967. He wore upper dentures and it is believed he was in the water seven to ten days.

Pants: Blue, Suit Style, Dress pants with large metal buttons
Shoes: Black, Oxford, Pointed Shoes, size 7 or 8

Case reference: 2021052226.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., Daniel Leslie was last seen at Terrapin Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2014001197.CaseDesc: On March 30, 2004, a motorist travelling on Hwy 21 at Content Bridge noticed human remains in the Red Deer River. Stettler RCMP were contacted and the remains were brought to shore a short time later. The body was badly decomposed but had some clothing attached and there appeared to be a tattoo on the body’s right arm.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2012020001.CaseDesc: Todd Beeching has been missing since mid 2005 although it wasn't reported until May 27, 2011.  He is believed to have been last seen in the Midway, BC area.

Case reference: 2014006218.CaseDesc: Lori Kasprick, who sometimes went by "Lovey", was last seen in the mid-1970s.  She was from Hilliard and going to school in Mundare when last seen.  Lori may have had ties to Tofield and Ryley.  Her grandparents lived in Holden at that time, and Lori could have made acquaintance with others her age when going to visit.

Case reference: 2006025799.CaseDesc: Anthony Roberts was last seen driving his vehicle east on King Street in Prescott, Ontario, on January 8, 1996. He was reported missing on January 19, 1996, and has not been heard from or seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014002260.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1993, William Kacuiba was operating a snow machine on the North Saskatchewan river near Prince Albert, SK. His snow machine went through open ice and searches of the water and area, including air searches, failed to locate his body.

Pants: Black, snowmobile; possible yellow stripe down the sides
Scar: Left Hand, 1.5 cm scar on back of 2nd and 3rd finger
Left Wrist, 2 cm scar on the back of the wrist

Case reference: 2014005505.CaseDesc: Forrest Schab was last seen on August 13th 2010 in Mexico City, Mexico.

Case reference: 2012020065.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1979, Shane Olecka was reported missing to the Beausejour RCMP. Shane was last seen leaving his home the previous day to go rabbit hunting. He was an experienced woodsman and there was no logical reason for him to be overdue. The weather conditions worsened to 'blizzard-like' on December 3rd and made the search efforts very difficult. The police conducted ground searches with the assistances of a police dog, members from the Canadian Forces base and local volunteers. The ground search was terminated on December 8th due to inclement weather.

Jacket: Blue, Rabbit-fur trim on hood, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2014001816.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1981, Wayne Martin was seen for the last time while he was out for a walk at the Rideau Heights Campground in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020087.CaseDesc: James Carlson was last seen between 7:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m. at a local business in Watrous, SK. On May 5, 2010, Mr. Carlson's 1985 Chevrolet Monte Carlo was found in a rural area south of Rosthern. Police have not located Mr. Carlson.

Hair: Brown, Balding in front , longer in back

Case reference: 2014004635.CaseDesc: In 1986, Sarah Skunk visited with family members located in Mishkeegogamang First Nation and Shabaqua, ON. Since that time, she has not been heard from by any family members. Family fears that she may be deceased. Sarah was known to frequent Vancouver BC, Sudbury ON, and Washington State, USA. Sarah spent some time on the streets. She was known by numerous aliases and may have had children.

Mark: Mouth, Wart on inside of mouth

Case reference: 2005004399.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1998, the remains of an unidentified man were found while cleaning out the intake to the Sir Adam Beck Hydro Generating Station. A single bone was all that was recovered. He is believed to have been in the water for many months to many years.

Case reference: 2014002270.CaseDesc: On 2 July, 1992, Behnam Amjadi was seen for the last time when he left his residence in the Côtes-des-Neiges et Notre-Dame-de-Grace district in Montreal, Quebec. Behnam has not been seen and has not contacted his ex-spouse or his brothers in Iran since.

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2014006246.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1991, Jason O'Donaghey's roommate reported him missing as he had not been seen for 3 days. There were rumours that Jason left North Vancouver voluntarily, but his whereabouts are still unknown. He was a talented artist who may be making a living by selling aboriginal carvings.

Hair: Black, Long, Short on top, long at bottom
Shirt: Cotton, White, Dress shirt with longsleeve

Case reference: 2014003011.CaseDesc: In June 1980, William Dailey, an American citizen, left his home in New York State and traveled to Alaska with two friends. William was last seen in July 1980, in the Yukon on the return trip from Alaska. The men had been travelling in a 1972 Dodge dark blue flatbed pick-up truck with racks.

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.
